sentences.en: Both of them have been through an awful lot and hopefully now I can help them rebuild their lives.
sentences.cn: 他们两人都曾历经磨难，但愿现在我能帮助他们重建正常的生活。

sentences.en: Camels rebuild fat stores in their hump.
sentences.cn: 骆驼在自己的驼峰内重新贮备了脂肪。

sentences.en: Everyone would have to work hard together to rebuild the economy.
sentences.cn: 所有人都应该一起努力以重建经济。

sentences.en: I covenanted to pay $ 5000 a year to rebuild the college.
sentences.cn: 我立书保证,每年付五千美元帮助重建那所学院.

sentences.en: It requires trading companies and manufacturers rebuild new relationship for common benefit.
sentences.cn: 这就要求厂家和商家为了共同的利益,构建新型的厂商关系.

sentences.en: It's out of the question to rebuild the towers.
sentences.cn: 重建那座塔是不可能的.

sentences.en: Jack used to be a thief, but now he's seen the error of his ways and is trying to rebuild his life.
sentences.cn: 杰克过去是小偷, 但是现已知过能改重新做人了.

sentences.en: Jane began to rebuild her social life which had been non-existent since her marriage.
sentences.cn: 简开始重新建立自己自结婚以来便陷于沉寂的社交生活。

sentences.en: Production and profits soared and people began to rebuild their old homes.
sentences.cn: 产量和收入提高了,人们开始翻新自己的老房子.

sentences.en: The church was completely rebuilt in the last century.
sentences.cn: 这座教堂在上个世纪全面重建。

sentences.en: The company is making every effort to rebuild its business.
sentences.cn: 这家公司正在尽一切努力来重建自己的企业.

sentences.en: They had to rebuild their homes after the havoc of the hurricane.
sentences.cn: 遭受飓风的巨大破坏后,他们不得不重建家园.

sentences.en: They say they will stay to rebuild their homes rather than retreat to refugee camps.
sentences.cn: 他们说他们将留下重建家园而不是躲到难民营里。

sentences.en: This temple is pulled down every twenty years and then rebuild in its original form.
sentences.cn: 每隔二十年,人们就将圣庙推倒,再按原来的样子重建一次.

sentences.en: Two weeks later, surgeons carried out the operation to rebuild his face.
sentences.cn: 两周后，外科医生实施了手术以复原他的面部。

sentences.en: Wilson's intention is to rebuild his career and put distance between himself and his reputation.
sentences.cn: 威尔逊打算东山再起，并让自己远离虚名浮誉。

words.tran_cn: 重建；改造，重新组装；复原

trans.tran_en: to build something again, after it has been damaged or destroyed
to build something again, after it has been damaged or destroyed
